Comment: It was never supposed to be 60. The Constitution only requires simple majority for most things. It was Senators who made a procedural rule that 3/5 were needed to end *filibuster* which has changed drastically in use since the 70's. So the so-called "nuclear option" is just changing the procedural rules again to reduce to stopping power of the filibuster.   My take: The filibuster was intended to encourage discussion, but has lately been used to stifle it by preventing legislation coming to a vote. A more moderated use of the filibuster that is not unlimited would be ideal, still encouraging deliberation, but allowing the Senators to put their votes where their mouths are.
